title: Commending the courageous Fort Drum soldiers for their valiant military service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending the courageous Fort Drum soldiers for
their valiant military service, each of whom made the ultimate sacrifice
serving their beloved country as members of the United States Army

WHEREAS, The courage and bravery of our  military  personnel  since  the
United  States  Armed  Forces  commenced  Operation  Enduring Freedom in
Afghanistan in October of 2001, and Operation Iraqi Freedom in  Iraq  in
March  of 2003, will ensure our continued role as a Nation that embodies
the ideals of democracy,  and  as  a  defender  of  liberty  for  people
throughout the world; and
  WHEREAS, Members of the Armed Services from the State of New York, who
have  served  so  valiantly and honorably during Operation Iraqi Freedom
and Operation Enduring Freedom,  deserve  a  special  salute  from  this
Legislative Body on behalf of the people of this great Empire State; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, it is the sense of this Legislative Body to commend
the courageous Fort Drum soldiers for their  valiant  military  service,
each  of  whom made the ultimate sacrifice serving their beloved country
as members of the United States Army; and
  WHEREAS, The brave and honorable soldiers  from  Fort  Drum  who  lost
their  lives  fighting for their country in the year 2010 are: SPC Scott
A.  Doolittle, SSG Charles P. Dozier, SPC  Timothy  J.  Fitzgibbon,  SFC
Todd  M.   Harris, CPL Joshua A. Harton, SGT Michael D. Kirspel Jr., MSG
Kevin Nauman, SGT Michael F. Paranzino, SFC Charles M. Sadell, PFC Clin-
ton E.  Springer II, and SPC Blake D. Whipple; and
  WHEREAS, The banner of freedom will always wave over our  beloved  New
York and all of America, the Land of the Free and the Home of the Brave;
and
  WHEREAS,  Residents  of this great State must never forget the courage
with which these men served their country, and must  recognize  that  no
greater  debt  is  owed than that owed to those who gave their lives for
their beloved Nation and to those who continue to be missing in  action;
and
  WHEREAS,  The  freedoms and security we cherish as Americans come at a
very high price for those serving in the military in times of  conflict;
it  is fitting and proper that we who are the beneficiaries of those who
risk their lives, leaving their families behind,  express  our  appreci-
ation  and  eternal  gratitude for their sacrifices and courageous acts;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  the  courageous  Fort  Drum soldiers for their valiant military
service, each of whom made the ultimate sacrifice serving their  beloved
country as members of the United States Army; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the families of those brave young men who died in the service
of their country.
